column1: 00:00|midnight|"When I say dark
column2: I mean his skin was the purest
column3: most beautiful shade of black I’d ever seen. Squid ink at midnight would not have been so black. His clothes were the same: a well-tailored jacket and slacks
column4: a crisp shirt and tie – all cut from the fabric of a neutron star. His face was inhumanly handsome
column5: chiselled obsidian. His long hair was combed back in an immaculate oil slick. His pupils glowed like tiny rings of lava."|"The Sword of Summer"|"Rick Riordan"

15:00|"three p.m."|"‘You realize check-in time is three p.m.
column2: ’ he said. ‘If you die earlier in the day
column3: I can’t guarantee your room will be ready.’"|"The Sword of Summer"|"Rick Riordan"

column1: ap 07:00|Seven|"‘Other newcomers?’ I asked.
Sam nodded
column2: her eyebrows furrowed. ‘Seven in one night is a lot.’

column1: ‘Is that good or bad?’"|"The Sword of Summer"|"Rick Riordan"
~ 05:00|"about five in the morning"|"At about five in the morning
column2: I finally gave up on sleeping. I went to the restroom to wash my face. Clean towels hung on the rod. The hole in the wall had been repaired. I wondered if it had been done by magic or if some poor schmuck had had to fix it as a punishment from the thanes. Maybe tomorrow I’d be the one plastering the wall."|"The Sword of Summer"|"Rick Riordan"

column1: ~ 06:00|"around six in the morning"|"It must have been around six in the morning. The eastern sky was just starting to turn grey. My breath steamed in the air."|"The Sword of Summer"|"Rick Riordan"
10:00|"10 a.m."|"A display by the door listed upcoming viewings. The top one read: MAGNUS CHASE. The date was today
column2: starting at 10 a.m. The door was locked. The lights were off."|"The Sword of Summer"|"Rick Riordan"

column1: ap 02:00|"two o’clock"|"At the prow
column3: occasionally shouting warnings to his brother
column4: ‘Rocks to port! Iceberg to starboard! Kraken at two o’clock!’"|"The Sword of Summer"|"Rick Riordan"
